docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, April 29. -- At the Old Salon, which opens this week, it is evident that members of the Society of French Artists have been put upon their mettle by the successes of their rivals of the Champ de Mars. The consequence is that the Salon of 1894 contains a better display of pictures than have been brought together for several years before at the Palais de l'Industrie.

headline.main: PICTURES OF THE OLD SALON; THE SOCIETY OF FRENCH ARTISTS ON ITS METTLE. Good Effect Produced by the Rivalry of the Champ de Mars Salon -- A Much Finer Display Than Usual at the Palais de Plndustrie -- Still, Favoritism Has Secured the Admission of Worthless Works -- Some of the Pictures Exhibited.
